item.description: Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1586; 09:43PM; 7200 N Balboa Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oPio1i; Lake Balboa; PRELIM: As many as four vehicles involved, with two persons trapped. No further details. title.a: Knockdown - #LaurelFire Greater Alarm Structure Fire 12/13/2021 INC#1085

item.description: Knockdown - #LaurelFire Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1085; 04:21PM; 6261 N Laurel Canyon Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3m1G0hq; North Hollywood; Address Corrected from Sylvan Street. It took 100 LAFD Firefighters just 44 minutes of well-coordinated offensive operations to access, confine and fully extinguish flames within a one-story 250' x 100' vacant row of commercial buildings, the site of a previous fire (date, time and circumstances still to be determined). Though persons believed to be transients were seen leaving the building on LAFD arrival, none reported anyone injured or remaining in the building. A comprehensive search of the still smoldering premises continues. No persons discovered within or injuries thus far reported. LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Erik Scott is at scene to assist the media. The fire cause remains under investigation.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC1 BC10 BC14 BC15 BC17 CE83 CM42 E102 E203 E235 E239 E260 E278 E289 E290 E298 E35 E39 E81 E88 E89 EA1 EM14 HR3 PI1 RA102 RA60 RA89 T3 T35 T39 T60 T78 T89 T90 T98 UR3 UR88; CH8; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

item.description: Update #LaurelFire Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1085; 04:05PM; 12100 W Sylvan St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yrv29N; North Hollywood; Address Remains Tentative. LAFD Public Information Officer, Captain Erik Scott is on scene (in place of PIO Ortiz). The firefight continues, and no injuries have been reported. ; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC1 BC10 BC14 BC15 BC17 CE83 CM42 E102 E203 E235 E239 E260 E278 E289 E290 E298 E35 E39 E81 E88 E89 EA1 EM14 HR3 RA60 RA89 T3 T35 T39 T60 T78 T89 T90 T98 UR3 UR88; CH9; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

item.description: Update #LaurelFire Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1085; 03:50PM; 12100 W Sylvan St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yrv29N; North Hollywood; With 96 LAFD personnel assigned, this incident, known as the Laurel Fire is at Greater Alarm status. LAFD Public Information Officer, Firefighter David Ortiz is en route.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC1 BC10 BC14 BC15 BC17 CM42 E102 E203 E235 E239 E260 E278 E289 E290 E298 E35 E39 E81 E88 E89 EA1 EM14 HR3 RA60 RA89 T3 T35 T39 T60 T78 T89 T90 T98 UR3 UR88; CH9; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

Update Pedestrian Fatality; INC#1461; 08:30PM; Metro B (Red) Line Station - 6250 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNHRKl; Hollywood; Apparent male (unknown age / affiliation / circumstances) was apparently struck by and has been discovered lifeless beneath the mid-section of an unknown direction Metro B (Red) Line subway train now stopped at the Hollywood/Vine Station platform. LAFD responders are working with Metro Los Angeles to assist the uninjured passengers and train operator in safely exiting the train, before they assist the Coroner's staff with the discreet and dignified removal of the decedent, who remains beneath but is not physically trapped by the train. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for service information. Media Inquiries: Metro Los Angeles, LAPD Transit Bureau (Incident #3774) and Coroner; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC13 BC5 E220 E229 E235 E27 E52 E76 E82 EM11 HR3 RA41 SQ21 T20 T29 T35; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey

Pedestrian Struck; INC#1461; 08:15PM; Metro B (Red) Line Station - 6250 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNHRKl; Hollywood; PRELIM: (Unknown age / gender / condition / affiliation / circumstances) pedestrian reportedly struck and trapped beneath unknown direction Metro B (Red) Line subway train now stopped at Hollywood/Vine Station. LAFD responders are still seeking to access the patient. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for service information. Media Inquiries: Metro Los Angeles and LAPD Transit Bureau (Incident #3774); FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC5 E220 E229 E235 E27 E52 E76 E82 EM11 HR3 RA41 SQ21 T20 T29 T35; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#0669; 11:28AM; Sullivan Fire Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IDgrge; Pacific Palisades; LAFD land and air response to a helmeted 23 year-old male mountain bicyclist in serious condition with head, arm and shoulder injury sustained in a fall. An LAFD rescue helicopter was able to land nearby, and is being assisted by LAFD ground crews in medically stabilizing the patient, who will be carried on a stretcher to the nearby aircraft for continuous in-flight care during direct transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 BC9 BP19 E19 E269 H1 H2 H3 HA1 HA2 HA3 RA19 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0273; 05:32AM; 5704 S 6th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oNeF4p; Hyde Park; Further updates on this incident describe a fire in the wall on the first floor which traveled up to the 2nd floor. There are no injuries. The arson investigator was canceled and it is being handled by the incident commander. No further details.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC13 E266 E294 E46 E94 RA266 RA66 T66 T94; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0273; 05:20AM; 5704 S 6th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oNeF4p; Hyde Park; FIRE NOW OUT: Firefighters arrived to find a two story, single family dwelling (later determined to be divided into more than one unit) with smoke showing from the 2nd floor. They initiated an offensive fire attack and achieved at knockdown in 13 minutes. Five occupants of the building safely exited and did not require any medical treatment. The incident commander requested an arson investigator to respond for the cause investigation. The original 9-1-1 call was received at 5:07AM. No further details.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC13 E266 E294 E46 E94 RA266 RA66 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart
